segments.text: I notice that woman, completely absorbed in drying her plate, as if nothing else matters.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: It makes me feel a bit exasperated; how can she not see the mess right beneath her feet?
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The water flows over the sides of the sink like a small waterfall, and yet she remains oblivious.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: Her indifference irritates me because it puts everyone at risk, especially those children.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I can only imagine the chaos that would ensue if someone slipped on that puddle.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The boy is wobbling on that stool, and my heart races every time he reaches for another cookie.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: It seems all too easy for him to lose his balance and fall.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I wonder if she knows how reckless they are being, or if she just carries on in her little bubble.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I wish I could shake her out of her routine and make her see the danger before it escalates.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: But all thatâ€™s left is to stand here and watch, impatiently waiting for the inevitable.
segments.speaker: PAR
